tasks.task: Restoring a tractor's hydraulic system
subtasks: Identifying the problem area in the hydraulic system
Locating the damaged or malfunctioning components
Disconnecting the hydraulic system for repair
Inspecting hoses, filters, and connectors for damage or blockages
Replacing any faulty hoses, filters, or connectors
Resealing any leaks by tightening connections or applying sealant
Reconnecting the hydraulic system
Testing the hydraulic system's functionality

tasks.task: Checking and reapplying grease to the front wheels
subtasks: Positioning the tractor in a well-lit area for easy inspection
Inspecting each front wheel bearing for signs of wear or damage
Applying grease to the wheel bearings using a grease gun
Checking the wheel link lubrication points and applying grease as needed
Ensuring that all grease fittings are properly lubricated

tasks.task: Lubricating the machine's attachment points
subtasks: Identifying all attachment points on the machine that require lubrication
Accessing the attachment points, which may involve removing covers or guards
Applying lubricant (oil or grease) to the moving parts at each attachment point
Ensuring that each attachment point functions smoothly after lubrication

tasks.task: Attaching a rear extension plate to a tractor
subtasks: Measuring the necessary dimensions for the extension plate
Prepping the tractor by gathering necessary tools and ensuring the area is clear
Aligning the tractor with the position where the extension plate will be attached
Connecting the extension plate to the tractor's rear hitch mechanism
Securing the extension plate in place with bolts or pins

tasks.task: Operating a tractor during fieldwork
subtasks: Activating the hydraulic system and adjusting the working speed
Guiding the tractor through the field, ensuring even coverage of the machine's action (e.g., plowing, planting)
Monitoring the tractor's performance and making adjustments as necessary
Managing the tractor's direction and speed to avoid damaging crops or equipment
Switching between different implements as needed during the day’s work

tasks.task: Installing a new headlight on a tractor
subtasks: Determining the appropriate type of headlight for the tractor model
Removing the old headlight, which may involve disconnecting electrical wires and disconnecting from the bracket
Preparing the new headlight by checking its connections and mounting bracket
Attaching the new headlight to the tractor’s headlight bracket
Connecting the electrical wires to the tractor’s electrical system, ensuring safety and proper function
Testing the new headlight to ensure it is properly aligned and functioning

tasks.task: Checking and adjusting the combine's header height
subtasks: Assessing the current header height based on the crop type and processing requirements
Using the combine’s height adjustment mechanism to lower or raise the header
Verifying the correct cutting height by observing the combine's performance and making any necessary fine adjustments

tasks.task: Cleaning a sprayer's nozzle
subtasks: Disconnecting the sprayer and isolating the nozzle to be cleaned
Carefully disassembling the nozzle and removing any clogs or blockages
Cleaning the nozzle components with a suitable solvent or cleaner
Reassembling the nozzle and reattaching it to the sprayer

tasks.task: Performing preventive maintenance on the combine
subtasks: Inspecting all moving parts and tensioning belts as needed
Checking and replacing oil and filters in the engine and hydraulic systems
Tightening loose bolts and checking for any visible wear or damage on the combine's components

tasks.task: Assisting with planting and harvesting operations
subtasks: Attaching planting implements (e.g., seed drills) to the tractor and adjusting settings
Loading the combine with harvested crops and securing them properly
Monitoring the progress of planting or harvesting and coordinating with team members

tasks.task: Checking the grain color meter settings on a combine
subtasks: Understanding the purpose and function of the grain color meter
Calibrating the color meter to provide accurate moisture readings
Adjusting the threshold levels for when the combine should automatically adjust its header height based on grain moisture

tasks.task: Adjusting the sprayer boom height
subtasks: Determining the appropriate height for the sprayer boom based on the crop height and ground slopes
Fine-tuning the boom height as the spraying operation progresses
Making sure the spray is evenly distributed across the field by adjusting height or using deflection booms as necessary

tasks.task: Re-securing a fence post that was knocked down
subtasks: Assessing the damage to the fence post and surrounding area
Removing any debris or obstructions from the post and base
Securely driving the fence post back into the ground, using stakes or support wires if necessary
Reinforcing the base of the post with concrete or other stabilizing material

tasks.task: Activating a grain cart
subtasks: Checking the grain cart's hydraulic lift system for any malfunctions
Ensuring the grain cart is properly connected to the truck and that all safety features are engaged
Operating the grain cart to load and unload grain as needed

tasks.task: Inspecting and replacing a broken axle on a tractor
subtasks: Locating the broken axle and isolating it from the rest of the tractor
Removing the machinery attached to the axle for easier access
Removing the axle from the tractor frame, possibly using tools to break seized components
Inspecting the axle for any additional damage and determining if parts need replacement
Replacing any necessary bearings, seals, or other components on the axle
Reassembling the axle and reattaching it to the tractor

tasks.task: Troubleshooting an engine that is not starting
subtasks: Checking the battery and ensuring it has sufficient charge
Verifying ignition system components like the spark plugs and wires are functional
Inspecting fuel lines and filters for blockages or leaks
Clearing the air filter if necessary and ensuring proper engine ventilation
Testing the starter motor and ensuring the engine is receiving proper lubrication

tasks.task: Cleaning the combine's threshing cylinder
subtasks: Disconnecting the combine and isolating the threshing cylinder
Removing debris and plant material from the cylinder blades
Inspecting the cylinder for wear or damage and making adjustments if necessary
Lubricating the cylinder's moving parts to ensure smooth operation

tasks.task: Refueling a tractor or combine
subtasks: Reserving the appropriate fuel types for different machines (diesel for tractors, sometimes kerosene for combines)
Monitoring fuel levels and planning refueling stops during long operations
Attaching fuel lines or inserting fuel canisters into the machines
Ensuring proper fuel flow and checking for leaks after refueling

tasks.task: Conducting a pre-harvest inspection of a combine
subtasks: Checking the overall condition of the combine, including the engine, hydraulic systems, and cab
Ensuring all safety features and lights are functioning properly
Testing the combine's operating efficiency and making adjustments before the harvest season

tasks.task: Applying fertilizer to crops using a heightForner
subtasks: Positioning the heightForner in the correct height above the crops to ensure uniform application
Adjusting the fertilizer spreader’s discharge width as needed for the field conditions
Operating the heightForner to distribute the fertilizer accurately and without excessive dust kickup

tasks.task: Adjusting the combine's auger speed
subtasks: Determining the appropriate speed for the combine's auger based on grain moisture and flowability
Manually adjusting the auger control or using an electronic interface to set the desired speed
Monitoring the auger’s performance during operation and making any necessary speed adjustments

tasks.task: Ensuring proper exhaust gas emissions from a tractor
subtasks: Checking the tractor's exhaust system for leaks or blockages
Ensuring the air filter is clean and not restricting airflow
Testing emission levels to confirm compliance with local regulations
Adjusting the fuel-to-air mixture if necessary to meet emission standards
